entry.title: Minute entry from 2025-11-13 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: Order

entry.title: Entry #39 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: TEXT ORDER The Court is in receipt of the letter by Defendants Exscientia p.l.c., Andrew Hopkins, and David Nicholson [Docket No. 38], requesting that the Court enter a final judgment in favor of all Defendants. On October 10, 2025, the Court dismissed Plaintiffs' amended complaint in its entirety without prejudice and permitted Plaintiffs to file an amended complaint within thirty (30) days [Docket No. 37]. That time has passed, but Plaintiffs have not filed a second amended complaint. Plaintiffs' silence suggests that Plaintiffs have elected to stand on their pleadings, making the Court's order of dismissal final and appealable. Accordingly, Plaintiffs are hereby ORDERED to respond to Defendants' letter [Docket No. 38] no later than Tuesday, November 18, 2025. If no response is submitted, the Court intends to enter final judgment as requested by Defendants with no further notice to Plaintiffs. So Ordered by Chief Judge Renee Marie Bumb on 11/13/2025. (Costigan, Roberta) (Entered: 11/13/2025)

entry.title: Entry #37 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: ORDER granting 26 MOTION to Dismiss; that the Amended Complaint is DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE; that Plaintiffs shall be given leave to file an Amended Complaint within thirty (30) days of the date of this Order to address the deficiencies noted in the accompanying Opinion. Signed by Chief Judge Renee Marie Bumb on 10/10/2025. (adc, ) (Entered: 10/10/2025)

entry.title: Entry #35 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: Transcript of Motion Hearing held on 9/16/2025, before Chief Judge Bumb. Court Reporter/Transcriber John Kurz (856-576-7094). NOTICE REGARDING (1) REDACTION OF PERSONAL IDENTIFIERS IN TRANSCRIPTS AND (2) MOTION TO REDACT AND SEAL: The parties have seven (7) calendar days to file with the Court a Notice of Intent to Request Redaction of this Transcript to comply with Fed.R.Civ.P.5.2(a) (personal identifiers). Parties seeking to redact and seal this Transcript, or portions thereof, pursuant to L.Civ.R. 5.3(g) must e-file a Motion to Redact and Seal utilizing the event `Redact and Seal Transcript/Digital Recording`. Redaction Request to Court Reporter/Transcription Agency due, but not filed, by 10/14/2025. Redacted Transcript Deadline set for 10/23/2025. Release of Transcript Restriction set for 12/22/2025. (js) (Entered: 09/22/2025)

entry.title: Entry #33 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: ORDER that the Court GRANTS, IN PART, AND RESERVES, IN PART, Defendants' Motion to Dismiss 26 ; that the Court DISMISSES WITHOUT PREJUDICE Plaintiffs' claims based on Exscientia's Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the Code) and Defendants' statements referencing the Code in SEC filings and annual reports, see Am. Compl. 89-97, 106-07 (references to the Code), 108-110 (references to the Code); that the Court RESERVES on the remainder of Defendants' motion pending oral argument; that the Court will hold oral argument on September 16, 2025 at 11:00 AM in Courtroom 1 of the United States Post Office and Courthouse, located on the 3rd floor, 401 Market Street, Camden, New Jersey 08101; that the Court reserves the right to supplement the record with its reasoning adjudicating the motion at a later date. Signed by Chief Judge Renee Marie Bumb on 8/28/2025. (sm) (Entered: 08/28/2025)

entry.title: Entry #22 in DORIN v. EXSCIENTIA P.L.C., 1:24-cv-05692
entry.summary: TEXT ORDER This matter comes before the Court upon the letter filed by Defendants Exscientia p.l.c., Andrew Hopkins, and David Nicholson, requesting a pre-motion conference concerning a proposed motion to dismiss [Docket No. 19]. Having reviewed that letter, and the response thereto filed by Plaintiffs Frank Campanile and Robert Sullivan [Docket No. 21], the Court does not believe that a pre-motion conference would be productive at this time. Therefore, Defendants may proceed with filing its proposed motion if they choose to do so. So Ordered by Chief Judge Renee Marie Bumb on 12/19/2024. (Costigan, Roberta) (Entered: 12/19/2024)
